p.s: In the scene at hand you can see that Chris is an important person in Starr's life.

This shows that Chris is popular and therefore liked and maybe even admired by other students.

Nike is a popular brand and is seen as cool by teenagers and so is Chris.

Starr is wearing the same shoes.

Both these aspects show that Chris is very attentive on Starr thus caring for Starr.
He focuses on her.
When their eyes meet Starr looks away and into her locker which shoesshows that she has some kind of problem with Chris.
The close up of StarrsStarr's faces when Chris puts his headphones on her is used to shows StarrsStarr's reaction to the music.
A beat that he made solemonlysolemny to apologise to Starr with.
She starts to smile but catches herself and gives the headphones back because she breaks the character of the upset girlfriend that wants an explanation for her boyfriendsboyfriend's action.

When they are both talking the camera switches between close ups of their faces to see their reactions but also to see who is speaking and their feelings and expressions whilst speaking, until it focuses on Chris's phone to show that he is unplugging his headphones.
He starts to dance to the beat and Starr starts laughing.
The camera starts to zoom into StarrsStarr's face and Chris dancing.
It zooms in from a medium shot of Starr to a close up to her face to clearly show that she is laughing.
This scene shows that Chris is not afriad of making a fool out of himself to make Starr happy.
It also shows that he cares for Starr and their relationship.
In conlusion you can say that Chris is portrayed as cool, popular, caring, happy person who is willing to fight for his relationship with Starr.
Their relationship is based on talking about their problems, finding solutions and caring for each other.
